info.name: Public Resource collection example
info.description:
With the LiquidAccount API you can access your Liquid Account data realtime, but you can also maintain several resources.

To use this API you must have access to a IQNOMY account with username and password. 

To use this Postman collection:
- create a local environment
- fill in your IQNOMY account id as variable {{IQAccountId}}. This is used in the URL's

Authentication
Your first post is Request offline token.
Fill in your username and password in the header. Do the post and you will get a token. This token is automaticly stored in your local environment.

Now every 60 seconds you have to use MyLiquidSuite API - Grant Refresh. This will refresh the token.

item.name: Returns list of all resource collections

exec: // tests["Test if response is array"] = Object.prototype.toString.call(jsonData) === '[object Array]';
tests["New collection exists as an object"] = Object.prototype.toString.call(jsonData) === '[object Object]';
tests["Test if resources in response is array"] = Object.prototype.toString.call(jsonData.resources) === '[object Array]';
tests["Test if number of resources is 5"] = jsonData.resources.length === 5;
tests["Test if resources property exists"] = jsonData.hasOwnProperty('resources') === true
tests["Test if resources in response is null"] = jsonData.resources === null;

request.description:
Put request with part of the resources. Left out from the original post resource with id 18608 and introducing a new resource with id 23232324. The other resources from the original post are also in this put. 

Expecting:
* create resource 23232324
* not deleting resource 18608
* editing resource 18605

item.name: Check if put result is saved

exec: tests["Test if resources in response is array"] = Object.prototype.toString.call(jsonData.resources) === '[object Array]';
tests["Test if number of resources is 6"] = jsonData.resources.length === 6;
tests["Test if resource with id 18605 type is edited"] = test1;
tests["Test if resource with id 18608 type is not deleted"] = test2;
tests["Test if resource with id 232323232324 type is created"] = test3;
tests["Test if number of resources is 6"] = jsonData.length === 6;
